channel.title: MoparScape Classic Checklist
channel.description:
The first thing that needs done is a RSC client to run inside of MoparScape 4, I'll post the instructions I wrote for xEnt here, so hopefully one of you can do it, please post here if you can.
[quote="Moparisthebest"]Would one of you be interested in getting the mudclient to run in MoparScape 4, since you could get it done before I would be able to? I need to write a good tutorial on it, but since you guys are familiar with Java this should be sufficient. You simply need to have a jar with a class named 'client' in the default package that implements org.moparscape.iface.ClientInterface, it is extremely well commented so you know what is needed. That interface, as well as the examples of the 317 and 508 client are currently here: http://cache.moparisthebest.com/MoparScapeSources.jar
You can test your client simply by providing a file://path/to/mudclient.jar for the 'Custom Client' field here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/moparscape4.php (contrary to what that page says, you do not need to provide a CRC, or anything else)
If one of you could get that done, then I could just set up the server and get it running and 'official' very quickly.[/quote]
Other than that, I'm not sure how far xEnt got on the authentication with the forum password, I sent him those instructions via PM, if he needs someone else to do it I'll repost them here and give one of you access to work on it.

item.title: MoparScape Classic Checklist
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

6 is still the recommended version, and until that changes to 7 and it is shown to be working just as well as 6, we should stick with 6.

edit:
Not to say that changes incompatible with 7 shouldn’t be worked on and fixed, just that we shouldn’t make it not runnable with 6 for quite awhile.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Classic Checklist
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:71, topic:394722”][quote author=-Nothing link=topic=491906.msg3813127#msg3813127 date=1321110294]

[quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=491906.msg3804512#msg3804512 date=1320344844]

Can Peeter’s Darkquest plugin quest system be used?
[/quote]Nope, we’re going to add a better one using the awesome features that Scala has.

https://github.com/Lothy/MoparClassic/issues/15

Please just don’t hardcode any quests it looks really retarded, kryptix hardcoded all of his quests and it looks like shit.
[/quote]If you don’t want it hardcoded then you can write them all… I’m not making the dialog, rewards, etc. configurable; that’s a gross waste of time.[/quote]
Make a decent quest system and I will write every damn quest for you.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparScape Classic Checklist
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I wasn’t saying I won’t add those permissions, but I’m not just going to start adding them willy-nilly. I’ll have a look at it in a day or two, I’m sure it won’t be that much more work to get it running.

The amount of work is irrelevant, the time it’s going to take to finish is going to be more than to just make a launcher specifically for it.

Also, can you take a look at this post:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
